info.headline: Flood Watch issued July 29 at 8:45PM CDT until August 2 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Des Moines IA
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Des Moines IA has issued a Flood Watch for the following rivers in Iowa...
Iowa River near Tama Hwy E49 affecting Poweshiek and Tama Counties.
Iowa River at Marshalltown affecting Marshall County.
Cedar River at Waterloo affecting Black Hawk county.
Black Hawk Creek at Hudson affecting Black Hawk county.
* WHAT...Flooding is possible.
* WHERE...The Iowa River at Marshalltown, or from Minerva Creek near Albion to Timber Creek near Le Grand.
* WHEN...From Thursday evening to early Saturday afternoon.
* IMPACTS...At 19.0 feet, Water affects Iowa 14 north of the river as well as Iowa 330 south of Albion.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 PM CDT Tuesday the stage was 15.7 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached Thursday evening. - Flood stage is 19.0 feet.
info.instruction:
For the latest waterway observations and forecasts refer to weather.gov/desmoines/water.
River forecasts include observed precipitation plus forecast precipitation over the next 24 hours.

parameter.value: FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY EVENING TO EARLY SATURDAY AFTERNOON
